name: Grand Hotel President

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from 2 weeks at The Grand President, All previous quotes are true, some rooms have fantastic views others just small balconies with no view (suggest you check when you book, prices do reflect standard of room, so don't moan if you don't get what you expected), that said rooms are clean and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Sweet Sorrento

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Marcia, and Lee are there for your every need and do their jobs very well, great people and good luck Lee on the Wedding,
reviews.title: Fantastic Thomson Hotel but Very Poor Entertainment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel are all brilliant and so friendly it just makes the Holiday more special, Luigi the Maitre de in the restaurant is a real joy and makes you feel very welcome (especially the ladies) a great guy,
reviews.title: A Most Beautiful Part of Italy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: Food is varied and to a very good standard, (beware your clothes will shrink in the wardrobe !!!!!)
reviews.title: Fantastic staff, serving great food in a location that is out of the world!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes things are a bit pricey but its Italy and a tourist area, so if you don't like it don't go.
reviews.title: Not to Thomson Gold Standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from this hotel. Wow! It was absolutely fantastic. The hotel was spotlessly clean, the staff very welcoming, helpful and friendly. - everyone from the cleaners, the waiters and the reception staff. The food was first class with an excellent buffet breakfast and waiter service dinner.
reviews.title: First Class Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only down side is the distance from the hotel to the town of Sorrento. The hotel courtesy bus is OK but times are quite limited - especially the last one at night. We went on the open top bus trip and were taken back to Sorrento and unfortunately had to wait about 2 and half hours for the courtesy bus - so we walked back and it took us about an hour!!
reviews.title: Second Visit to This Wonderful Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: Ensure you book a sea view as several other guests were very disappointed to be looking at a brick wall when they opened their windows!! It would have been nice to have had tea and coffee making facilities in the room but at least there is fridge in the room and a free security safe!
reviews.title: the most fun we've had on holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The views are fantastic and the roof terrace is a calm, serene area to relax and enjoy the peace.
reviews.title: Totally disagree with reviewer from Zurich

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely recommend this child free hotel to our friends. We were told that it will be a Thomson Platinum from 2012 and it certainly should be.
reviews.title: Overrated as a 4 star hotel - Thomson Gold rating is also a joke

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having just returned from a great week in Sorrento I feel it may be helpfull to write a report. First the Hotel has the most Fantastic views imaginable pictures cannot do the views justice.The rooms are great with a bottle of water supplied daily with tea and coffee making facilities.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC VIEWS EVENING MEAL LACKED IMAGINATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food. Breakfast was buffet with a good choice of hot and cold food no complaints.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, wonderful staff, location a little remote but would be happy to go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner was passible there must have been a different chef doing the starters and main courses. The starters where very good and full of flavour the main course lacked any flavour and imagination.
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel & Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On Thursday night they have a Gala Buffet the food on this evening was outstanding I cannot understand why the food can be so good on this night and flavourless the rest of the week.
reviews.title: Fantastic.Best holiday for ages

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: A must is a Trip to Capri and Ana Capri take the 8-30 courtesy bus into Sorrento and walk to the harbour the boat over costs 13euros by the big ferry and 15 euros return by the fast boat. I would advice not to by a return as the big ferry does not return until 6-15 and you can get a fast boat about every hour.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel has the most professional and friendly staff, who frequently went above and beyond the call of duty to help guests to have a relaxing holiday, and really made us all feel at home. The rooms are spacious, clean and well presented. The hotel is a short, but extremely steep, walk out of town, but this is compensated by a regular hotel shuttle bus into town and the magnificent views from the hotel. The swimming pool, roof terrace bar and restaurant all share the enchanting view over Sorrento and its beautiful bay. For us the only negative was that during the summer months the hotel is entirely taken over by Thomson and their reps and entertainment. The loud evening entertainment caused many guests we spoke to to have sleepless nights, especially as the clientel tended to be more mature couples. I'd love to return, especially during the winter months - it's the Italian staff that make this hotel so special.
reviews.title: Best hotel staff in the world!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited this Thomson Gold hotel which goes Platinum next year and it's easy to see why. This is a very classy hotel in a stunning location, overlooking the beautiful town of Sorrento, and across the Bay of Naples from Mount Vesuvius, which we felt obliged to climb on one of the excellent excursions.
reviews.title: Stunning location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was marvellous and the service from the efficient and elegant waiters was exemplary. There was an entertainment team which did everything from yoga or pilates in the morning to songs from the musicals in the evening: all optional of course. There was a large piano bar, live music every evening and a quiet roof terrace bar, which shared the same spectacular view of the town and bay as the dining room and the swimming pool. Plus there are beautiful gardens, also with sunbeds and comfy chairs.
reviews.title: Be aware!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only downsides: although close to the town as the crow flies, it's 15 to 20 minutes on the courtesy bus to get down to the town. And there are no local shops for staples like bottled water or snacks so you have to buy from the hotel or bring back from town. Also, we always miss complimentary tea and coffee in the rooms on the continent (so if you are the same, take your own supplies!)
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff, food and views are all excellent.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

description: Hotel offers all modern facilities; sitting high above Sorrento with unique views of the hills and the Bays of Sorrento & Naples.
